script: This is the most important discovery of the century, and everyone wants to see it.
Yes, the press will be there.
This is your big day, Mr. Burnish.
You won't be disappointed. I promise.
Nah. I'm going out with Peilin, but maybe I'll stop by.
Eh. What are you supposed to be?
-I've got stuff to do. -Stuff? What is this stuff?
Either be busy, or be on holiday.
Mom, Nai Nai, I've got it covered.
What on earth do you think she does all day?
-Would you guys give me a break? -Hey!
We'll be back in a few hours.
So, Jin, are you going to Shuo's this weekend?
No, I'm heading to Beijing to check out my school.
She looks like she slept in a dumpster.
He breaks left. He breaks right.
He's going in for the dunk!
Come shoot hoops with me. Come on.
Sorry, Peng. I don't have time.
Why don't you ask the other kids?
The other kids are too little.
And some of them are freakishly good.
Come on, Yi. You never play with me anymore.
Peng, I've been busy all day.
-Hey, your cousin will play with you. -I'll pick you up tomorrow.
As usual, he's got a date.
Hey, Yi. You know I can smell you from all the way over here, right?
I'm sorry. Is there any aftershave left, or did you use the whole bottle?
Why? You hoping to borrow some?
You guys want to work out some of this tension on the court?
Forget it, Peng. We wouldn't want to mess up Jin's hair.
Don't. I know what you're thinking, so just don't say it.
We're just going to give up on her?
I'd never give up on Yi.
Look, we both know what she's been going through.
If we're patient and don't push her, then just maybe...
We've been waiting for you to eat.
Oh. I... I ate on my way back. So I'm good.
Either eat here or there, but never on the move.
Hey, Yi, why don't we all sit down together tonight.
You don't want to be so short like your mother.
-Oh, I'm... okay. Thank you, Nai Nai. -Yi, wait.
What would you say to playing a little violin for us after supper?
-Remember when you used to... -I... I can't.
Hold up. Spotted something at two o'clock.
Bam! It came out of nowhere.
Did you see where it went?
Lady, I just told you. It was gone.
Um, let me take care of the repairs to your truck.
A little compensation for your silence.
Let them cool. You'll burn your mouth.
And Mrs. Yuan in 4-B says you're going to trim her poodle's toenails.
No one wants a lazy granddaughter.
What do you need to do all that for?
Can we just talk about this later, Nai Nai?
Whoo. Yeah, you're definitely a boy.
I don't know where you came from, but you...
You stay in here, okay? There...
There are people looking for you.
My dad used to play for me. It always made me feel better.
Is that... is that your home?
Considered to be no more than fairy tale and myth, enthusiasts still hold out hope that these creatures actually do exist.
Now, you will get every car we have out there, or I will send you back to your job at the shopping mall.
We need every car out on the street.
I was dribbling, and the guy was like, Oh, no, and I was like, Oh, yeah.
Hey, Nai Nai, want to shoot some hoops?
You know I only play for money.
Peng, go get your cousin Jin, and see who stole my air conditioner.
Hey! What are you doing out here?
Where did you get that? No, no, no...
Peng, that does not make sense. Why would they take it to the roof?
-Guys, what are you doing up here? -Hey.
-There's a wild beast on our roof. -Hang up, Jin.
-Turn up that scanner. -Yeah, yeah. On Heping Road.
That's the yeti! Ring Mr. Burnish.
Jin, what have you done? He's not dangerous.
Look at him. He's a yeti!
Oh, we're never gonna catch up to them.
How many girlfriends do you have?
Down there. That boat's leaving the city.
You have to get on it.
Oh, no. How is she gonna get away?
-Wait, wait. What time is it? -Eight o'clock. Why?
There they are. Come on, Peng.
When that boat lands, don't stop.
Don't stop until you reach your mountain.
I guess I'm coming with you, huh?
Ugh. Your mom's gonna kill me.
No, no, no. You think this is funny?
Do you even know how much What were you thinking, Yi?
You have gotten me into so much trouble.
I am so mad at you right now. You know what?
I can't even talk to you right now! That's how mad I am!
Now, how am I supposed to prove the yeti exists when I don't have...
Dr. Zara, what am I going to do?
The science community will be there. The press will be there.
The world will be there, watching with their eyes.
Mr. Burnish, there are many rare and exotic animals you have collected over the years.
You're the only one in the world to have a newly born clutch of rare whooping snakes.
Go in your hole, you weird snakes.
These creatures are to be respected.
They would make a lovely belt.
Mr. Burnish, they are one of a kind.
A belt that goes whoop. Do I want that?
Wait, how many snakes are there supposed to be?
We promised the public a yeti, and nothing else will do.
I don't care if the yeti is dead or alive.
Your gerbil is freaking me out.
Jerboa. Duchess is an albino jerboa.
And she, too, is one of a kind.
Sir, as a zoologist, it is my mission in life to make sure that all animals are protected, especially the rare and exotic ones.
That is the only reason I agreed to find your yeti.
For a few short days, we had one, but I cannot go to that unveiling empty-handed.
I will not be made into a laughingstock again.
A dockworker saw a creature and some kids boarding a cargo barge last night.
Dr. Zara, you are the best in your field.
Please, help me get him back.
We bring the yeti back alive.
Captain, where did that boat land?
-Peng is, uh... -Look at all those teeth.
Yeah. Mm-hm. She's, uh, she's checking out the university.
How long will we be here?
Cafeteria food is a little rich.
Well, I got to go, Ma. Bye.
I cannot believe that you made me lie to my mother.
First, you go over the Yellow Mountain.
And that river will take you most of the way to the Himalayas.
This is how you're going to get home.
That has to be hundreds of miles away.
I just hope he can make it all that way.
'Cause we're not at the dock anymore.
I can't believe how beautiful it is out here.
I can't believe I haven't eaten in 24 hours.
Come on, come on, come on...
Okay, look, the next boat leaves around 5:00, so let's hope that's enough time to find our way back to the dock.
Yes, waiter. I'm ready to order.
I'll have some of Nai Nai's pork buns.
-With extra pork! -All right. Get up, Peng.
-We got to go. -And a side of pork.
Not funny, all right? This is cashmere!
Tell Nai Nai's pork buns I love them.
Hey, Jin, did you get enough to eat?
Let's just say I've got blueberries in places where blueberries should never be.
Because, in about five minutes we won't be able to see our hands in front of our faces.
And that is exactly why we've got to keep moving.
Come on, Peng. We need to get back to that dock.
Well, my mom told me that the stars are our ancestors who always watch over us.
I'm entirely cut off from my social life.
Because, unlike you, I like having friends.
Is that what you were gonna say?
Well, for your info, I'm a self-proclaimed loner.
Because in the morning, Peng and I are headed back to the city.
-Yi. -You've seen what he can do. He's...
Oh. So now he's a magical yeti.
Do you realize how crazy you sound?
Look what happened with the blueberries.
That wasn't him! That was a natural phenomenon.
I declare a thumb war. Go!
Will you two please just give it a rest?
I'm beginning to sound like my parents.
That's why they get along so well.
He's probably, like, the same age as Peng -but in yeti years. -Stop hitting yourself.
Right. There's no way that giant thing is a kid.
Wait. I'll prove it to you.
Aw. You have your mother's eyes.
I will make sure you get home.
Take him all the way back to Mount Everest?
Jin, he needs to get back to his family.
And what about your family? Don't they need you, too?
Don't talk to me about family.
Your life is so easy, Jin.
Do you even... Do you even want to be a doctor, or do you just think that you'll... I don't know, you'll look good in white?
All right. Call me shallow all you want.
I don't care if you think I'm crazy.
Your Nai Nai said you stopped playing -after your dad died. -Peng!
You know, I really liked your dad.
Well, we better head out if we're gonna make it to the Yangtze River.
And Dahe Village has boats leaving for the city every hour.
Okay, well, when we get there, you and Peng can take a boat back, but...
Well, that boat pulled in yesterday morning, but we've unloaded all of the cargo and didn't find anyone.
Would you mind if we search it again?
And it looks like he fancies soda.
Sorry, Doctor. There's no sign of them anywhere.
-Sir, the yeti has disappeared. -It has been...
so long since I've been out in nature.
You there. Chop it down and put it in a bag, will you?
-Right away, sir. -I want it in my penthouse...
We should divide the team Captain!
Now, on the map, that village is only, like, a centimeter away.
It must just be on the other side of the...
We are not going over that.
Come on, Everest. I'll race you.
Okay. I mean, I wish I was a basketball superstar.
Starting in the championship game, the mighty Peng!
Wait, is that a drone? Cool!
Not so cool. Not so cool.
Oh, no. It's those guys from the city.
I told you this was a crazy idea.
Those little thieves stole my yeti.
I wish there was a way out of here.
Yi, let go of that. It's dangerous.
Everest, are you sure about this?
No! Peng! Get down from there right now!
-Are you catching this? -Is that a giant...
Look, stop messing about and get my yeti!
Uh, yes, sir. Let's take 'em down.
So, who's going to tell Mr. Burnish?
-I'm Dr. Zara. -I know who you are.
Your gerbil is freaking me out.
A boy that knows his gerbils. I like him.
Bad? Listen, you've got this all wrong.
That wild beast is unpredictable, even dangerous.
We were trying to rescue your friend when the yeti kidnapped her.
I own that yeti. He is my yeti.
I... I just need to find my cousin and my friend and get 'em back to the city in one piece.
I can get all of you back to the city, but the only way I can help your friends is if I know where they are. Do you know?
That yeti is the pinnacle of my research.
I don't know where they are, but I do know where they will be.
You saved us, and now we're...
All I know is we're a long way from Jin.
Yeah, well, that's his fault. He should have jumped.
I mean, why... why doesn't he ever just jump?
He did. He jumped on that boat back in the city.
That's what got him on this trip in the first place.
Yeah, but that's because he was worried about you.
Yi, he thinks of you as family, too.
Everest, Jin said Yi was like his little sister when they were kids.
She was always doing something crazy that would get her into trouble, so he had to watch out for her.
I... I think we should get going.
But don't worry. I can get us out of here.
I rushed back to tell the world what had happened, but without proof...
You spent all these years trying to get your proof?
I'm so used to looking down on the world, it's amazing how small one feels just by looking up.
Mr. Burnish, we need to get an early start.
Thanks to Jin, we've learned the yeti's whereabouts.
You're kind of cute, you know, in your own ugly, beady-eyed kind of way.
Don't worry. I'll get us out of here.
Everest is nowhere near his mountain, and for all we know, Jin...
Jin could be in trouble right now, and it's...
Jin said this trip was a crazy idea, and...
I don't know, maybe... maybe he's right.
Yeah. And the map on his cell phone.
It's okay, Everest. It's just a koi fish.
Why are they swimming against the current?
They're actually trying to get back home.
Yeah, let's just put him back.
Do you think he'll make it?
It's... just something my mom told me.
It means that when things get really tough...
We have to keep going. Come on.
Come on, you guys, let's go.
He said in the sweetest little voice, You're cute in your own ugly, beady-eyed kind of way.
Ugh! I tell you, he's going soft.
If that kid is right and we find the yeti at the river tomorrow, use any means possible to take him down.
I thought we had to keep the yeti alive.
The buyer won't pay us unless he's still breathing, but if he's a little banged up, who cares?
They're just gonna chop him up into little pieces for their experiments anyway.
Well, what do we do with the kids?
If you want your ten per cent, you'll get rid of them for good!
And get rid of this rodent I've been carrying around.
Do you know how hard it is to keep up this British animal-lover act?
Duchess? But she's a one-of-a-kind albino jerboa.
She's just a rat, you idiot!
I think you're better off with this guy.
It's okay, babies. It's okay. I got you.
Nope, nope. I can't do it.
All right, fine, just take it!
Yeah, but how are we gonna catch it?
Now, this is the way to travel.
I mean, how... how do you do that?
Maybe it's his gift, like when you play the violin or when I play basketball.
Now that... that is a gift.
-Well, this is the village. -Do you see Jin?
Through that mob? Are you kidding me?
-We need to both look for him. -What about Everest?
Keep looking. He said they would be here.
I can't believe he crashed my bike.
Coming in at four-foot-ten and ready to take the game, the mighty Peng!
Jin, I knew you'd be here.
Captain, don't you dare let them get away!
Hold on. This little lady has a few tricks up her sleeve.
You got a little something right here.
That violin meant everything to me.
When we were little, you know my dad used to play all the time.
But every night, when he was tucking me in, he would play this one song... just for me.
I don't know, it... made me feel like everything...
I'm sorry for what I said.
I just... I don't know why.
I miss him, and I don't want to miss him, but...
I haven't even cried yet, Jin.
And my family, we're all so distant, and I...
I... don't know what to do.
Well, are you sure they're the ones who are distant?
But you were right about me, too.
Yeah, hate to admit it, but, I mean, that thought about looking good in the white doctor's coat, it did cross my mind.
I am a horrible, horrible person.
If those people find Everest, we're all in danger.
Wait, do... do they know where I'm taking him?
And the yeti's powers will grow even stronger the closer he gets to those mountains.
But there's still one more chance to capture your yeti.
At the foothills of those mountains, there's a bridge.
Once the yeti crosses it, he'll blend in, disappear.
We will never find him again.
I've never seen powers like those before.
After this, no one will ever laugh at you again.
Captain, we are going to need reinforcements.
What do those powers mean for us?
That yeti's price tag just doubled.
Hey, you guys, did you find that thing?
See? It's as good as new.
Hey. When did you buy these?
Oh, I... I didn't buy them.
He kept postcards of all the places he wanted to take us someday.
Yi, they're all of the places we've been.
We've been to all of these.
This is the place that my dad wanted me to see the most.
You brought me here, didn't you?
I wish Dad were here to see this.
We are so going to the Himalayas.
Come on. If we keep going, we'll get to the Himalayas by morning.
Those guys are not gonna stop until they get... Everest!
We still have to keep going, though.
You know, when Everest goes home?
Like, will you guys still want to hang out?
You know, I'll sure miss seeing these stars.
Yeah, but even though we can't see them, we'll still know they're there.
So, that's kind of cool, isn't it?
Go to your mountain now, before it's too late.
Get my yeti! Get him now!
Mr. Burnish, we're missing our chance.
The yeti must be protected, and the best way to protect the yeti... is to let him go.
Captain, order your men to stow their weapons.
I'll make sure the yeti's out.
You are never going to escape again.
Ahh! I thought we had to keep the yeti alive.
You are by far the most extraordinary creature I have ever seen.
That is exactly why the world...
Now, can I please help you get back to the city?
I promised to take Everest home...
You're going to take Everest all the way to Everest?
Sir, with all due respect, when Yi sets her mind on something, nothing is impossible.
But there is something I have to insist that I give you.
They just wanted our coats, Dave.
Guys, it sure is a long way up there.
They'd be so good at basketball.
I can't believe the journey's over.
I missed you both so much.
It's good to have you back, granddaughter.
Who is ready for Nai Nai's pork buns?
Look what I found on your doorstep.
Peng! Uh, it was, um, life-changing.
You know, I totally see what you mean about these pork buns.
Uh-huh. There is no one in the world who likes these pork buns more than me.
Who? Who else like my buns?
